biblStruct.note: Generally the scholarly consensus lead the greek term monachos (monk) back to the Syriac word îhîdaya. Evidences from the targumim, however, make it possible to assume that monachos on its early stages of development which are partly available to us through the Nag Hammadi writings Gospel of Thomas and Dialogue of the Savior might have been influenced by the concept of the Aramaic yhyd’a.
